title: "Blitzcrank pulls from his right arm. Use this to your advantage when dodging"
body: Thanks for the tool tip Riot. Except for the fact that the hitbox is wide enough that it will hit you regardless of what side you're on.

The blitz arm thing is one of the few universally useful quotes that isn't dependent on skill or user preference. The tooltips become incredibly useless after a while if they dispense only information relevant to gameplay, since not everyone subscribes to the same strategy, nor are they shackled to it. What's true for you won't be for the person sitting next to you.
Useful? No. Universally useless? You betcha. Some tooltips are fine, but this one is highly misleading. The hit box renders the discrepancy in centering irrelevant.
I'm pretty certain the hitbox is still biased to the right, so if you run slightly to his left, you won't get grabbed. I've experienced this first-hand.

if blitz is for example facing north (12 o'clock) and you are positioned to the south (6 o'clock) of him... if you move in a westerly direction (clockwise) it takes longer for blitz to turn and shoot at you than if you move in a easterly (counterclockwise) direction

so for example you are blue, you had a bad engage: ur adc is dead their adc is dead, ur a Sona low on health running to tower from big bad blitz,  crossing perpendicular east into his right hand as u move to tower will get u grabbed easier.... crossing perpendicular west so his body has to move to follow u increases the odds of dodging the grab, the angle being larger the further west u are able to move
Let's be honest here if you're a Sona you aren't dodging that skillshot regardless what fancy math you do.
If Blitz leaves on a train from Chicago heading west at 60mph, how long will it take people to quit complaining about his grab's hitbox?
